summary: Rosh Hashanah is the Jewish New Year, a time of celebration and reflection. It is a two-day holiday, marking the start of the civil year in Judaism. People often eat special foods like honey and apples, especially apples dipped in honey, to symbolize a sweet and happy new year. They also go to synagogue, hear the shofar (a horn) being blown, and think about how to improve in the coming year. This holiday is one of the High Holy Days, a time to show respect and consider one's actions.
title: Rosh Hashanah
